personal.name: Milton Daniel Mathan
personal.title: Technology Leader | SaaS, E-Commerce & Scalable Platforms
personal.bio: Senior Engineering Leader architecting scalable SaaS and commerce platforms, while building high-performing teams that deliver impact
personal.extendedBio: I am a Senior Engineering Leader with 16 years of experience in platform engineering, cloud architecture, and software development across global organizations. I bring deep expertise in multi-cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP), private-cloud deployments, event-driven systems, API ecosystems, and scalable microservices, coupled with a proven ability to define and execute technology strategies, lead enterprise-wide transformations, and build high-performing teams across development, operations, and security disciplines. Skilled in engineering leadership, Agile delivery (Scrum/SAFe), and DevSecOps practices, I have a strong track record of aligning cross-functional teams to deliver measurable outcomes. My approach bridges technical execution with business priorities, fostering a culture of ownership, innovation, and continuous evolution across complex environments. I have architected AI-integrated platforms, including a Salesforce-based chatbot powered by the Model Context Protocol (MCP) that enables conversational access to consumer profile data. Currently, I am leading the development of an integration layer extending Martech systems into Data Warehouse capabilities, embedding AI tools to enable intelligent data interaction across business and engineering teams. I actively apply modern developer productivity tools such as GitHub Copilot, Claude Code, Kiro, and Amazon Q to streamline workflows and enhance engineering velocity. Above all, I am dedicated to cultivating a culture of psychological safety, ownership, and collaboration, empowering teams to thrive in environments that embrace innovation and continuous transformation. I excel at the intersection of engineering, security, and business strategy, ensuring technology drives efficiency, resilience, and meaningful business outcomes.
